body_html: pytorch is built around programs, not graphs. copying/modifying a forward function and returning the particular layer you want is the right way to do things. If you want to return a middle layer more conveniently, write your model forward to take a name string as well, and return that name layer.
body_text: pytorch is built around programs, not graphs. copying/modifying a forward function and returning the particular layer you want is the right way to do things. If you want to return a middle layer more conveniently, write your model forward to take a name string as well, and return that name layer.
body: pytorch is built around programs, not graphs. copying/modifying a forward function and returning the particular layer you want is the right way to do things. If you want to return a middle layer more conveniently, write your model `forward` to take a `name` string as well, and return that `name` layer.
